page.title: 06PHEASANT REARING IN CHILMARK
page.content: {Pheasants}are reared for shooting on two farms in the Chilmark-Teffont area In both the{hen and cock pheasants}are penned in the{spring}and the eggs collected. In Teffont the farmer sends the eggs off elsewhere to be hatched. Big{syndicate shoots}which start shooting in October take the earlier hatchings; the farmer himself starts shooting later so buys back the later hatchings, rears them on the farm and releases them in the autumn.{1,500 eggs and as many poults are produced. A{recently established hatchery in Chilmark is wholly commercial and sells all its dayold chicks and older poultsto syndicates and private shoots In{1985,}the second year of business {6,000}dayold chicks and{6,000 poults were sold. The business is growing fast. ANNE McGRAIL
